title: Alliance Coat of Arms of Cornelis Calkoen and Maria van der Merct
description: Alliantie wapen met kroon van Cornelis Calkoen en zijn derde vrouw Maria van der Merct, waarschijnlijk ter gelegenheid van hun huwelijk in 1694. Calkoen was groothandelaar in lakenen, geweven stoffen en Turks garen, alsmede blauwlakenverver. Het wapen is omgeven door een krans van bloemen.

acquisition.creditLine: On loan from the Koninklijk Oudheidkundig Genootschap

iconClassDescription: cut flowers; nosegay, bunch of flowers

longTitle: Alliance Coat of Arms of Cornelis Calkoen and Maria van der Merct, Maria Moninckx, 1694
subTitle: h 397mm × w 297mm
scLabelLine: Maria Monninckx (1673-1757), watercolour, heightened with white and gold, over graphite, on vellum, 1694

label.title: Alliance Coat of Arms of Cornelis Calkoen and Maria van der Merct
label.makerLine: Maria Monninckx (1673-1757), watercolour, heightened with white and gold, over graphite, on vellum, 1694
label.description: In this drawing the Amsterdam artist Maria Monninckx surrounded the alliance arms that unite the Calkoen and Van der Merct families with a spectacular coloured floral wreath. A tiny garden tiger moth, a red admiral butterfly and a stem sawfly flutter around it. She achieved the brilliant colour by applying various layers of paint over one another and adding a touch of gold here and there.
